# indexOfSelectedItem

**Instance Property**

The index of the item last selected by the user.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var indexOfSelectedItem: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is the index of the selected item, or `-1` if no item is selected.

## Related Documentation

- **indexOfItem(withTag:)**: Returns the index of the menu item with the specified tag.
- **indexOfItem(withTitle:)**: Returns the index of the item with the specified title.
- **index(of:)**: Returns the index of the specified menu item.
- **indexOfItem(withTarget:andAction:)**: Returns the index of the menu item with the specified target and action.
- **indexOfItem(withRepresentedObject:)**: Returns the index of the menu item that holds the specified represented object.

## Dealing with selection

- **select(_:)**: Selects the specified menu item.
- **selectItem(at:)**: Selects the item in the menu at the specified index.
- **selectItem(withTag:)**: Selects the menu item with the specified tag.
- **selectItem(withTitle:)**: Selects the item with the specified title.
- **setTitle(_:)**: Sets the string displayed in the receiver when the user isn’t pressing the mouse button.
- **selectedItem**: The menu item last selected by the user.
- **synchronizeTitleAndSelectedItem()**: Synchronizes the pop-up button’s displayed item with the currently selected menu item.
